Fishing Effort Card - learn more: ℹ️ Hours of fishing effort is used as a proxy for measuring the potential economic loss to fisheries caused by the creation of protected areas. This report can be used to minimize the potential impact of a plan to fisheries, as well as identify and reduce conflict between conservation objectives and fishing activities. The higher the percentage, the greater the potential impact if access or activities are restricted.
Priority Areas Card - learn more:
<0> This report summarizes the proportion of Active and potential mining areas within this plan.

If MPA boundaries overlap with each other, the overlap is only counted once.
Report info status: These are <1>draft reports. Further changes or corrections may be made. Please report any issues.
SizeCard - introduction: national waters extend from the shoreline out to 200 nautical miles, known as the Exclusive Economic Zone (EEZ). This report summarizes offshore plan overlap with the EEZ and other boundaries within it, measuring progress towards achieving % targets for each boundary.
SizeCard - learn more:
<0> This report summarizes the size and proportion of this plan within these boundaries.

If sketch boundaries within a plan overlap with each other, the overlap is only counted once.
